body.p: To Thomas. E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. Your petitioner James K. P. Chapman respectfully States that on the 12th day of July 1865 he was tried and fined by the County Judge of Russell county for the offence of Breach of the peace and fined the sum of Thirty ($30). that at the time that said offence was said to be committed that he was in Company of two other men; who were all intoxicated with ardent spirits until unto drunkenness. that he has no recollection of what did occur at the time said offence was Said to be committed. of which and getting drunk. your petitioner promises not to be guilty of again: On account of his youthfullness being only 19 years of age. Your petitioner prays for the remission of said fine, and as in duty bound he will ever pray
We the undersigned residents of Russell County and acquaintances of James K. P. Chapman join in the foregoing petition and respectfully ask for a remission of the above named fine
